subject: AI & Agents
title: GANs: The Art of Adversarial Creation
description: A fast breakdown of GANs: The Art of Adversarial Creation for builders.

hook.text: Two neural networks fight each other. One creates fakes. One detects them. Both get better forever.

buildup.text: Ian Goodfellow invented GANs in 2014 after a discussion at a bar. He coded the first version that night.

discovery.text: The generator learns to fool the discriminator. The discriminator learns to catch the generator.

twist.text: Training GANs is notoriously unstable â€” mode collapse, oscillation, and vanishing gradients plague them.

climax.text: Despite the difficulty, GANs generated the first photorealistic AI faces and sparked the deepfake era.

punchline.text: Competition bred creation. The counterfeiter became the artist.

quiz.question: How do the two networks in a GAN interact?
options: The generator creates fakes and the discriminator tries to detect them
Both networks cooperate on the same task
One network trains and the other evaluates speed
